title: Beyond The Borders
opening: The next morning comes too quickly. Lyn has fought back the bandits’ attack. Now, she rushes for the border of Bern. If she can reach it, Lycia itself is not far off. For a moment, Lyn stops to imagine the face of a grandfather she’s never seen.

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: We’ve almost reached the Lycian border.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Once we cross, we’ll be safe from the bandits, right?

intro.speaker: Wil
intro.line: We should be. I doubt they’ll be willing to pursue us across the border.

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Lycia at last! It’s been a long time. Tomorrow, we’ll dine on a feast of Lycia’s finest foods! And the mistress of the inn at the crossing is said to be a beauty. Ah, yes… Food and love. No better way to restore a man’s soul! This is going to be a fine evening, eh, Kent?

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: If your behavior is as deplorable as ever, we’d best stay elsewhere. We’re not here for sightseeing!

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Oh, come now! That’s not fair!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Kent, the inn will be fine.

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: As you say, milady.

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Lyndis! You are truly an angel from on high!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: It’s nothing. Forget it.

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: Ah! We’ll finally be able to get a good night’s sleep.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Oh, no… Those bandits are persistent, I’ll give them that much.

intro.speaker: Bug
intro.line: Ah! Here they are! I’ve found ’em!!

intro.speaker: Wil
intro.line: What? Not again! They’re still after us?

intro.speaker: Bug
intro.line: Heh heh heh. Don’t think you’re getting away so easily!

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: You leave alive, and everyone’ll think the Ganelon Bandits have gone soft!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: So? We care nothing for you or your reputations! We must get to Lycia! Get in our way, and you’ll pay!

intro.speaker: Bug
intro.line: Cheeky little thing, aren’t you? Let’s get ’em, lads! And no holding back just ’cause there’s women with ’em! Wipe ’em out!

intro.speaker: Serra
intro.line: Oooh… We’re lost. This makes me so mad!

intro.speaker: Erk
intro.line: You told me you were certain this was the correct path.

intro.speaker: Serra
intro.line: What’s your point, Erk? What are you trying to say?

intro.speaker: Erk
intro.line: …I swear, you are NOT the woman I agreed to escort…

intro.speaker: Serra
intro.line: What? What’s that supposed to mean?

intro.speaker: Erk
intro.line: I heard someone was needed to escort a frail Lycian priestess to Ostia…

intro.speaker: Serra
intro.line: Yes, and I’m that priestess.

intro.speaker: Erk
intro.line: Frail? You? Serra, you have no need of any escort to protect you. Even the most hardened criminal would flee in terror after five minutes in your company. I’ll return your money. Gladly. Now, will you please go on to Ostia alone?

intro.speaker: Serra
intro.line: NO! You’re MY escort, Erk! MINE! You’re so clean and tidy. A noblewoman like myself can’t be seen without a proper escort. Your personality’s nothing special, but you’re not bad to look at.

intro.speaker: Erk
intro.line: I believe that’s my line. And I have to take you all the way to Ostia? I only hope my nerves can endure the journey.

intro.speaker: Serra
intro.line: What are you mumbling about? You’re so gloomy! Hm? Something’s happening over there. Let’s take a look!

intro.speaker: Erk
intro.line: Ah. Of course. The first opportunity to get involved in trouble, and she jumps right in. No amount of money is worth this. Hoo…

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Erk, a mage, and Serra, a cleric, have joined your group. Mages use the magic of truth to attack and damage their enemies. Clerics use staves to restore HP to their allies. Let’s try them both. First, select Serra.

battle.speaker: Serra
battle.line: Hello. You’re Tactician, right? I’m Serra. Nice to meet you. By the way, see this contrary mage here with me? His name is Erk. I think he’s been hurt. I am Erk’s employer. “Master,” I suppose you could say. What I’m getting at is… I was thinking of healing him free of charge. I know, I know. I’m generous to a fault. Hm? Why are you looking at me like that? Praise my generosity! Anyway, that’s the deal. Please direct me to him.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Press the A button, and select the staff from the menu.

battle.speaker: Serra
battle.line: I’m going to use my staff. Watch in wonder!

battle.speaker: Serra
battle.line: My staff! Let me use my staff!

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Clerics cannot wield weapons; therefore they can’t engage in combat. However, they can use their staves to restore HP to allied units. Besides healing staves, which restore HP, there are other staves with different abilities. It’s always a good idea to test out any new abilities you receive, so let’s do that now. Have Erk demonstrate his magic. Begin by selecting Erk.

battle.speaker: Erk
battle.line: You are Tactician? I am Erk. I’m not sure how I got in this mess. If I’m going to fight, however, I will show you the true power of magic!

battle.speaker: Erk
battle.line: I will show you the true power of magic!

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Magic, like Dorcas’s throwing axes, can strike enemies in adjacent squares as well as those at a distance. It’s very useful. Magic can penetrate even the strongest defenses, so it can be used in many situations. However, mages have few HP and low defensive abilities. To avoid counter-attacks, move in close to archers, and attack other fighters from 1 space away. Try and formulate combat strategies like this to be successful on the field of combat.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lyn
recruit-talk.line: Why are you fighting these bandits?

recruit-talk.speaker: Serra
recruit-talk.line: That’s not true! Those ruffians thought that we were with you!!! You got us into a terrible situation! Now, how are you going to get us out?

recruit-talk.speaker: Erk
recruit-talk.line: Serra, if you’d not been so meddlesome, this all could have been avoided. My apologies. Please trouble yourself with us no more.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lyn
recruit-talk.line: But…if you’re going to have to fight anyway, shouldn’t we team up? It will end things faster, right?

recruit-talk.speaker: Serra
recruit-talk.line: That’s true. Yes! That’s a good idea. Erk! Go and help these ladies.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lyn
recruit-talk.line: Very good. My name’s Lyn. SO tell me, will you join arms with us?

recruit-talk.speaker: Serra
recruit-talk.line: Yes, we’d be glad to. My name is Serra. This is my escort, Erk. Be a good boy, and go fight now, Erk.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Magic can be used to attack enemies both near and far. Plus, you might find that magic can hit an enemy that normal weapons do not harm. However… Mages are notoriously susceptible to physical attacks. Just because they’re versatile doesn’t mean you should put them in harm’s way. It does you no good if they are lost because of your carelessness.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Tell me, are you using the R Button? If there’s something you don’t understand, use the R Button to investigate. It’s essential. Place the cursor on a unit and press the R Button. This displays detailed information on the unit. You knew that, right? While that information is displayed, press the R Button again. That will get you even more detailed information. Did you know that? The R Button can be used in many other places, too. Anyway, when you come across something unfamiliar, try pressing the R Button! Won’t hurt to remember that!  Ah, so you’re a traveler? Listen to my advice: handle your money wisely. If you spend too much too soon, you’ll run out early and suffer later. There are other shops, so save about, oh, half of your money.

boss.speaker: Bug
boss.line: You’re gonna learn why people fear the Ganelon Bandits!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Nicely done, Tactician. That should just about do it.

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: What a surprise. You are very strong, Lyn.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Your staff is a wondrous thing. Healing powers amaze me.

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: Only those in the service of good can wield them.

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: Take care. Good-bye, Lyn.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Fare you well. You, too, Erk.

end.speaker: Erk
end.line: Good-bye.

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: Well, let us be on our way, Erk.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: What have we here? Another wildflower? Perhaps a butterfly?

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: What an absolutely delectable creature!

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: Oh my! Are you one of Lyn’s companions?

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: Please, call me Sain.

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: I’m Serra. I serve House Ostia.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: Serra… What a lyrical name. I am in service to Castle Caelin.

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: Oh! So is Lyn a member of the marquess’s family?

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: She is the granddaughter of our lord, the marquess.

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: Hmmm… Such an important person.

end.speaker: Erk
end.line: Serra…what deviousness are you contemplating now?

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: Tee hee! Having a person of power in your debt is never a bad thing!

end.speaker: Erk
end.line: You can’t be serious…

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: Oh, Sain! Do you think we could join the lady Lyndis’s company? She seems like such a nice person, and I would ever so much like to help her.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: Of course! We couldn’t be happier!! Why, we were only just saying how we need some more fighting power!

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: Are you being hunted or something?

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: Yes, it’s an inheritance dispute. Assassins everywhere.

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: Oh my! In that case, my healing staff and Erk’s magic should come in handy.

end.speaker: Erk
end.line: Well, I, er… It sounds…dangerous…

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: Your staff and magic would be extremely helpful! Please wait here! I will go and speak with Lady Lyndis on your behalf.

end.speaker: Erk
end.line: Unbelievable…

end.speaker: Serra
end.line: This is fantastic, Erk! Our good deeds will earn us gratitude beyond imagining!

end.speaker: Erk
end.line: I… I… I think I’m going to be ill.

end.speaker: Lundgren
end.line: That little girl crossed the border!?

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Yes, Lord Lundgren. She’s en route to Araphen…

end.speaker: Lundgren
end.line: Fool! Send out soldiers to meet her! Hold nothing back! Do anything to finish this now! First the old man, and now the girl… They cling to life like a drowning man to a rock! Double the poison’s strength! If he struggles, hold him down and pour it down his throat! Once the girl is gone, Caelin is mine. I will let no one stand in my way!
